image.altText: Portrait of a man on a bicycle on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Safety concerns about cracked footpaths and poor street lighting have led some Canberrans to question what they're getting for their rates.Â

title.children: 'It broke my bike. It broke me': These Canberra ratepayers want their footpaths fixed

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entrance.

props.synopsis: Jessie Gould pleaded guilty to more than 30 charges in the ACT Magistrates court related to a string of thefts in Canberra's north, after being caught by police hiding in a wardrobe following his failure to turn up to court.

title.children: Canberra man identified by fingerprints on stolen car's steering wheel freed

image.altText: A composite image of a broadcasting tower with a sign reading "ten" and an image of a woman with blonde hair smiling.

props.synopsis: Network Ten reporter Tegan George's bid to sue her employer over trauma she says she suffered covering the bushfire season in 2019 and 2020 ends in a confidential settlement.

title.children: Network Ten reporter Tegan George reaches settlement with broadcaster over bushfire trauma

image.altText: A woman with white hair pulled back wearing glasses sits in the drivers seat of a car holding the wheel, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Finding a parking sport at Canberra Hospital is an ongoing challenge for some regular visitors, and with a new emergency department opening last month patients are concerned the parking situation will worsen.

title.children: 'I've had enough': Wanda parks illegally when taking her mum to the Canberra Hospital

image.altText: A snowboarder smiling at the camera with gumtrees and snowy mountains behind them.

props.synopsis: As Australia's ski season comes to an early end, resort workers say that despite low pay which barely covers rent, fuel, and two-minute noodles, they'll be back again next year.

title.children: 'Best thing I've ever done': Why snowfields workers return year after year despite poor pay

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to media, as seen in an AI video

props.synopsis: Showing how easy it is to make deepfakes of politicians using artificial intelligence, independent senator David Pocock creates AI videos of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: David Pocock creates AI deepfakes of Albanese and Dutton as warning ahead of election

image.altText: Two men holding booklets entitled "The Integrated Energy Plan'' stand in front of  a back drop with "ACT Government'' logos.

props.synopsis: With an ACT election just six weeks away, tension between Labor and the Greens has developed into a public spat.Â

title.children: How friction between ACT Labor and the Greens developed into a public spat

image.altText: A tall apartment building, seen from below.

props.synopsis: ACCC chair Gina Cass-Gottlieb says commissions are driving up the cost of insurance as Four Corners exposes the hidden arrangements lining the pockets of brokers and strata management firms at the expense of apartment owners.

title.children: Insurance giant channelled undisclosed kickbacks to strata management firms

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie parliament

props.synopsis: Army veteran turned senator Jacqui Lambie says the "hard work starts today" ahead of the release of the final report of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.

title.children: Lambie demands defence be 'open and honest' as royal commission handed down

image.altText: Real estate agent puts up a sold sticker after this Mosman apartment sold at auction.

props.synopsis: Politics and timing are inextricably linked â sometimes, the Zeitgeist suits your story, other times it doesn't. Kamala Harris and Bill Shorten both know that the hard way.

title.children: Australia could be ready to say goodbye to negative gearing

image.altText: Kamala Harris smiles and points at something above her in the distance, in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: It has been a dream start to Kamala Harris's bid for the White House, and supporters are confident she'll beat Donald Trump in the popular vote â but the Electoral College is a different story.

title.children: Kamala Harris has a blue state dilemma that could cost her the election

image.altText: A close up of Nicki Hutley sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: It's not just older generations who think younger people are doing it tough. The list of people concerned about the impact of inflation on households includes economists, the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, and the Reserve Bank.

title.children: 'You can't blame the boomers': The generational divide behind Australia's cost of living split

image.altText: Brett Andrew Button faced court for the first time

props.synopsis: Judge Roy Ellis tells a Newcastle court the coming days of victim impact statements will be emotional as "never before have so many people been killed and injured in a single motor vehicle incident".

title.children: Judge warns 'unprecedented' sentencing hearing for Hunter Valley bus crash driver will be highly emotional

image.altText: A Telstra payphone in a remote setting with trees and grass

props.synopsis: Taxpayers and telcos spend nearly $300 million a year to guarantee access to landlines and payphones, even though fewer and fewer people are using them.Â

title.children: The little-known 'dinosaur' policy that could be holding us back from better phone coverage

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch

props.synopsis: In a polarised media world, it's never been more important to understand Lachlan Murdoch.

title.children: 'Do I need to sell my house?' The perils of writing about media mogul Lachlan Murdoch

image.altText: A fighter jet sits on a runway

props.synopsis: Israeli strikes on Syria's Hama countryside, including at a chemical weapons plant, kill at least four civilians, according to Syrian state media.

title.children: Israel carries out deadly strikes in Syria

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis:
Australia's largest strata title insurer Steadfast has halted trading on the ASX after a sharp decline in its share price in response to a 4C's investigation, while the market drops 0.8pc on opening.

Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX opens 0.8pc lower, Steadfast tumbles then halts trading after Four Corners investigation

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Steadfast halts trading on 4C's investigation and sharp fall in share price
ASX 200 opens 0.8% lower, Steadfast tumbles on 4C's investigation

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: As the government returns to parliament to pick a new fight on housing, new figures reveal a third of first home buyers are using federal support for help to buy a home.

title.children: A third of first home buyers are leaning on government for help to put down a deposit

image.altText: Flowers and balloons are gathered near a police car outside a school building

props.synopsis: A woman whose son is charged with murdering teachers and fellow students in the US state of Georgia called the school before the attack, according to her sister.Â

title.children: Mother of shooting suspect called Apalachee High School before fatal attack

image.altText: A Qantas jet passes a Jetstar plane, the logos on their tails visible.

props.synopsis: Nationals Leader David Littleproud has poured cold water on his colleague's proposal to use the threat of break-up powers against Qantas and Jetstar.

title.children: Nationals leader pours cold water on threat to break up Qantas and Jetstar

image.altText: Three firefighters stand on the footpath near a red fire truck, looking towards a brick house with police tape across it.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating whether two young children and a toddler were home alone when they were critically injured in a fire at Sydenham in Melbourne's north-west.

title.children: Two children and toddler critically injured in Melbourne house fire

image.altText: A photo showing a remote community mining town home

props.synopsis: Indigenous residents of the Manaburdurma Jabiru Town Camp are devastated the area's Mirarr traditional owners plan to demolish their homes to make way for a new road, as part of plans to redevelop the town into a Kakadu tourism centre.Â

title.children: Amid a national housing shortage, these town camp residents can't believe their community is to be demolished

image.altText: Lauren Parker and James Turner parade with the Australian flag at the Stade de France

props.synopsis: Australia's flag-bearers James Turner and Lauren Parker have paraded around the Stade de France and Paris bids au revoir.

title.children: 'Let's keep daring': Turner and Parker fly the flag as closing ceremony caps off Paris Paralympics

image.altText: A red four-wheel-drive is crushed by falling tree branches

props.synopsis: Officials warn that despite the typhoon's waning power, significant flooding is still possible in the aftermath of the typhoon.Â

title.children: At least 21 killed in Vietnam as threat from Typhoon Yagi continues

image.altText: An older man in a hard hat and an orange Hi-Vis vest stands on a dock in front of the water.

props.synopsis: The project to deliver new Spirit of Tasmania vessels has led to another resignation at ferry operator TT-Line, chief executive Bernard Dwyer, who was absent at a parliamentary inquiry today.

image.altText: Jannik Sinner holds the US Open trophy while red, white and blue confetti falls

props.synopsis: Italian world number one Jannik Sinner wins his second grand slam of the year, beating local hero Taylor Fritz in straight sets to claim the US Open.

title.children: Sinner's golden grand slam year continues with US Open final triumph over Fritz

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek stands behind Anthony Albanese at a press conference

props.synopsis: The federal government's plans to establish an environmental protection agency have hit a political impasse, calling into question whether the election commitment can be met before the end of this term of parliament.

title.children: Labor hitting political impasse seeking to establish environment cop

image.altText: A man and a woman looking over paperwork with a calculator and computer

props.synopsis:
In the United States, Americans can split or average out their income with their partner to reduce the tax they pay. Could this be adopted in Australia?

title.children: 'So blatant it's bordering on laughable': Family trust accounts minimise tax, so why can't couples have a joint tax return?

image.altText: Man wearing white shirt surrounded by people pointing mobile phones at him

props.synopsis: Prosecutors issue an arrest warrant for Edmundo Gonzalez in connection with the online publication of election result tallies.

title.children: Venezuela opposition candidate seeks asylum in Spain amid election fallout

image.altText: Children enjoying a hot beverage and toast.

props.synopsis: When students walk through the gates of Alexandra Hills State School, they can expect to attend class on a full stomach â but that isn't the case for all Australian children.

title.children: 'Normalise school breakfasts': The groups working to make sure all kids go to class with a full stomach

image.altText: Smiling man in a suit, stands holding the budget paper for 2023

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Treasurer Michael Ferguson announces a record $5.1 billion infrastructure spend days out from this year's state budget, despite a warning from an independent review.

props.synopsis: Sitting on the back of a bull and preparing to be launched into an arena, 20-year-old Leeuwin Gillett can feel the nerves and adrenaline building. In just a few seconds the world is going to look very different to him.
